intro: Retinodendron bancanum, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is toxic and can cause skin irritation. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in catkins. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
